etymology.description: Depicts a person extending the body as if stretching or reaching upwards
etymology.interpretation: The character 申(申) (shēn, "to extend") visually captures the image of a person stretching or reaching upwards, which directly relates to its meaning of extending or reaching.

examples.chinese: 图书馆将借阅期限申延(圖書館將借閱期限申延)。
examples.pinyin: Túshūguǎn jiāng jièyù qíxiàn shēn yán.
examples.english: The library will extend the borrowing period.

examples.chinese: 节日来临之际(節日來臨之際)，商家纷纷将优惠时间申长(商家紛紛將優惠時間申長)。
examples.pinyin: Jiérì láilín zhī jì, shāngjiā fēnfēn jiāng yōuhuì shíjiān shēn cháng.
examples.english: As the holiday approaches, merchants have extended their promotional periods.

examples.chinese: 老师建议学生将创意申延(老師建議學生將創意申延)，以迎接挑战(以迎接挑戰)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī jiànyì xuéshēng jiāng chuàngyì shēn yán, yǐ yíngjiē tiǎozhàn.
examples.english: The teacher suggested that students extend their creativity to meet the challenge.
